dataset.title: Soil Moisture taken with a neutron probe 1969-1974 from 11 sites: Weekly

address.deliveryPoint: Forest Soils Laboratory; Department of Forest Sciences; SNRAS; University of Alaska Fairbanks
University of Alaska Fairbanks O'Neill Building Room 322

abstract.para: These original basic fertilization experiments were started to give preliminary information for designing future experiments and to study basic long term fertilization responses in a range of age classes for the dominant forest types of interior Alaska. In addition, the instrumentation of the control plots provide long term information on various environmental parameters. No fertilization or growth measurements were done in the black spruce stands.

section.title: Access to Data
section.para: While metadata will be freely available to those requesting it, the data manager will assure that any restrictions on access to data sets in the database will be enforced. Data will not be released without proper permission first being obtained from the investigator who generated the data.

section.title: Use of data
section.para: Researchers should receive adequate acknowledgment for the use of their data by others and should be provided with copies of publications using their data. Users of data from the data base must be aware that data is not to be sold or redistributed.

section.title: Citing Bonanza Creek LTER Datasets
section.para: It is considered a matter of professional ethics to acknowledge the work of other scientists. Thus, the Data User will properly cite the Data Set in any publications or in the metadata of any derived data products that were produced using the Data Set.

section.title: Experimental Design
section.para: At sites 1, 3, 5, and 6a .04 ha control and fertilized plot were set up in 1969. Plots 1AC,3AC,3BC,5BC,6AC,6BC,and 8SC are controls while plots 1AF,3AF,3BF,5BF,6AF,6BF,AND 8STF are the fertilized plots.

section.title: Methods
section.para:
Three randomly located aluminum access tubes were used to assess relative changes in soil moisture as measured with a neutron probe at 15 or 30 cm intervals to a depth of 1.5 m. or as deep as possible: plot cm depth of readings
A complete fertilization was done (broadcasting) using rates of 111 kg N/ha as ammonium nitrate, 55 kg P/ha as treble superphosphate, and 111 kg K/ha as potassium chloride. Applications were made in fall of 1967 and each spring 1968-1975. No fertilization was done in the the area 7 plots. Plot 8STF was also thinned to 1600 stems/ha when set up in 1969. Except in area 1, growth was monitored with band dendrometers installed 1.4 m above ground. In area 1, growth was monitored using vernier calipers to measure diameter increases at two opposing points. At control plot weather stations, air temperature beneath the canopy was measured 1.4 m above the ground with recording thermographs. U.S. Weather Bureau thermometers were used to record weekly maximums and minimums. Thermistors at surface, organic-mineral soil interface, and 15, 30, 60, and 90 cm, installed in duplicate profiles, were used to monitor soil temperatures. Precipitation within stands was measured with standard 15 cm rain gauges. Neutron probe access tubes were installed and used to measure soil moisture at 25cm intervals to a depth of 1.5 m from 1969-1974. In 1989 the weather stations at areas 3AC,3BC,7UBS,7BS,and 8SC were replaced with Omnidata easy logger data loggers which were used to measure air temperature, relative humidity, and soil temperature (same depths as previous) at 5 min intervals with output every hour and 24 hour summaries. Three, one meter-square litter trays were installed in each plot and collected at least yearly. Litter collection was suspended after the 5/83 burn at 7BS and 7LBS. For years 1967-1981 four 1- sq ft trays were used at 1AC, and for the years 1972-1991 six .25-sq M trays were used at 45AC. For all other years and plots 1 square meter trays were used. All data is in grams/sq meter.

dataTable.entityDescription: Soil moisture data taken with a neutron probe.

attribute.attributeDefinition: number of probes to max depth of 1.5 m

textDomain.definition: number of probes to max depth of 1.5 m
